intro: Phanera sylvani, commonly known as the forest phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
